kit_interfaces

Class Kit

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • kit_interfaces.Kit
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BeetleKit

    public abstract class Kit
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    A kit in the Chemistry Passport Program is designed to teach children in grade k-6 a skill.
    Version:
    May 2, 2015
    Author:
    Humaira Orchee, Charlotte Dye, Sehr Sethi
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Kit

        public Kit(ChemistryPassportGUI mainGUI)
        Creates a new kit. This constructor is used when only the reward game needs to be added to the passport without the need for the entire kit to be created.
        Parameters:
        mainGUI - The main GUI of the entire Chemistry Passport Program.

      • Kit

        public Kit(ChemistryPassportGUI mainGUI,
   java.lang.Integer kitProgress,
   java.lang.Integer kitIndex)
        Creates a new kit. This constructor is used when only the reward game needs to be added to the passport without the need for the entire kit to be created.
        Parameters:
        mainGUI - The main GUI of the entire Chemistry Passport Program.
        kitProgress - The Integer representing user's progress on current kit.
        kitIndex - The integer associated with the current kit.
